alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:54AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Smoke From Wildfires Will Reduce Visibility And May Create Poor Air Quality... Multiple Wildfires in Oregon, Idaho, and Montana are producing high densities of smoke that is being blown into northern portions of Wyoming. Hazy skies and poor air quality are possible this afternoon and into tomorrow morning. * WHAT...Smoke From Wildfires. * WHERE...Northern Portions of the Area. This includes Yellowstone National Park, the Absaroka Mountains and the Bighorn Basin. * WHEN...Noon Sunday to Noon Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...It is recommended that individuals with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and minimize outdoor activities during this time.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Yellowstone National Park
